meanings.definition: The act of bringing power or control back to a central authority.
meanings.sent1: The recentralization of decision-making helped streamline the process.
meanings.sent2: The recentralization of power in the government was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent3: The recentralization of snack distribution in the office caused a stir among employees.
meanings.sent4: The recentralization of authority was like gathering scattered puzzle pieces back into one place.
meanings.sent5: The recentralization of control made the organization more efficient.

meanings.definition: The process of consolidating authority or decision-making at a central level.
meanings.sent1: Recentralization of decision-making led to clearer communication within the team.
meanings.sent2: The recentralization of authority was a strategic move by the company.
meanings.sent3: The recentralization of office supplies management was surprisingly exciting.
meanings.sent4: The recentralization of decision-making was like gathering all the threads of a story into one book.
meanings.sent5: The recentralization of power brought unity to the organization.
